meanings.definition: The act of acclimating or becoming acclimated.
meanings.sent1: Her acclimations to the cold weather took some time, but she eventually got used to it.
meanings.sent2: The acclimations of the new students to the school routine were evident in their behavior.
meanings.sent3: The acclimations of the cat to wearing a tiny hat were met with mixed reactions from the family.
meanings.sent4: His acclimations to the fast-paced city life were like learning to dance to a new rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The acclimations of the plant to the sunny spot by the window were visible in its growth.

meanings.definition: The process of adjusting to a new environment or situation.
meanings.sent1: The acclimations of the family to their new home involved exploring the neighborhood and meeting new neighbors.
meanings.sent2: After the move, the acclimations to the different time zone were challenging for the travelers.
meanings.sent3: The acclimations of the robot to human emotions led to some comical misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: Her acclimations to the role of team leader were like stepping into a new pair of shoes.
meanings.sent5: The acclimations of the astronaut to zero gravity were crucial for the success of the mission.

meanings.definition: The state of being accustomed to a certain climate or condition.
meanings.sent1: The acclimations of the desert animals to the scorching heat were fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent2: His acclimations to the early morning routine made waking up easier over time.
meanings.sent3: The acclimations of the picky eater to trying new foods were met with surprise by the family.
meanings.sent4: Her acclimations to the peaceful countryside were like finding a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The acclimations of the athlete to the high altitude training paid off during the competition.
